name: ext_R3_TriggerDefinition
title: Cross-version Extension for R3.TriggerDefinition for use in FHIR R2
description: This cross-version extension represents TriggerDefinition from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition|3.0.2 for use in FHIR R2.

element.short: Defines an expected trigger for a module
element.definition: A description of a triggering event.

element.short: The code-valued attribute of the filter
element.definition: The code-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path must be resolvable from the type of the required data. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type code, Coding, or CodeableConcept.

The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

element.short: The value of the filter, as a Period, DateTime, or Duration value
element.definition: The value of the filter. If period is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within the bounds determined by the Period, inclusive of the period boundaries. If dateTime is specified, the filter will return only those data items that are equal to the specified dateTime. If a Duration is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within Duration from now.

element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.short: The value of the filter, as a Period, DateTime, or Duration value
element.definition: The value of the filter. If period is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within the bounds determined by the Period, inclusive of the period boundaries. If dateTime is specified, the filter will return only those data items that are equal to the specified dateTime. If a Duration is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within Duration from now.

element.definition: The profile of the required data, specified as the uri of the profile definition.

element.short: Indicates that specific structure elements are referenced by the knowledge module
element.definition: Indicates that specific elements of the type are referenced by the knowledge module and must be supported by the consumer in order to obtain an effective evaluation. This does not mean that a value is required for this element, only that the consuming system must understand the element and be able to provide values for it if they are available. Note that the value for this element can be a path to allow references to nested elements. In that case, all the elements along the path must be supported.

element.short: Indicates that specific structure elements are referenced by the knowledge module
element.definition: Indicates that specific elements of the type are referenced by the knowledge module and must be supported by the consumer in order to obtain an effective evaluation. This does not mean that a value is required for this element, only that the consuming system must understand the element and be able to provide values for it if they are available. Note that the value for this element can be a path to allow references to nested elements. In that case, all the elements along the path must be supported.
Code filters specify additional constraints on the data, specifying the value set of interest for a particular element of the data.

element.short: The code-valued attribute of the filter
element.definition: The code-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path must be resolvable from the type of the required data. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type code, Coding, or CodeableConcept.

element.short: The code-valued attribute of the filter
element.definition: The code-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path must be resolvable from the type of the required data. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type code, Coding, or CodeableConcept.

The valueset for the code filter. The valueSet and value elements are exclusive. If valueSet is specified, the filter will return only those data items for which the value of the code-valued element specified in the path is a member of the specified valueset.

The valueset for the code filter. The valueSet and value elements are exclusive. If valueSet is specified, the filter will return only those data items for which the value of the code-valued element specified in the path is a member of the specified valueset.

The codes for the code filter. Only one of valueSet, valueCode, valueCoding, or valueCodeableConcept may be specified. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified codes.

The codes for the code filter. Only one of valueSet, valueCode, valueCoding, or valueCodeableConcept may be specified. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified codes.

The Codings for the code filter. Only one of valueSet, valueCode, valueConding, or valueCodeableConcept may be specified. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified Codings.

The Codings for the code filter. Only one of valueSet, valueCode, valueConding, or valueCodeableConcept may be specified. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified Codings.

The CodeableConcepts for the code filter. Only one of valueSet, valueCode, valueConding, or valueCodeableConcept may be specified. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified CodeableConcepts.

The CodeableConcepts for the code filter. Only one of valueSet, valueCode, valueConding, or valueCodeableConcept may be specified. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified CodeableConcepts.
Date filters specify additional constraints on the data in terms of the applicable date range for specific elements.

element.short: The date-valued attribute of the filter
element.definition: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path must be resolvable from the type of the required data. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

element.short: The date-valued attribute of the filter
element.definition: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path must be resolvable from the type of the required data. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

element.short: The value of the filter, as a Period, DateTime, or Duration value
element.definition: The value of the filter. If period is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within the bounds determined by the Period, inclusive of the period boundaries. If dateTime is specified, the filter will return only those data items that are equal to the specified dateTime. If a Duration is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within Duration from now.
